document.docAuthor: Ho, Hsuan-Ching, Smith, David G. & Tighe, Kenneth A.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the arrowtooth eel genera Dysomma and Dysommina in Taiwan, with the description of a new species (Anguilliformes: Synaphobranchidae: Ilyophinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the arrowtooth eel genera Dysomma and Dysommina in Taiwan, with the description of a new species (Anguilliformes: Synaphobranchidae: Ilyophinae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Dysomma anguillare Barnard, 1923
. A. NMMB-P 11125, 1 of 9, 372 mm TL. B. Unregistered specimen, ca. 300 mm TL. Both collected from Dong-gang fishing port.

subSubSection.paragraph: Body light brown to blackish dorsally, paler ventrally. Dorsal fin and most part of anal fin white; posterior margin of anal fin with black and white color. Caudal fin black with upper margin white.

Distribution. Widespread in the Indo-west Pacific and Atlantic oceans, although the taxonomic status of the various geographic populations is still to be determined. In Taiwan , it is the most abundant species of
Dysomma
and can be collected by bottom and midwater trawls from near the surface (< 50 m ) to as deep as
600 m .
